you can use the interfaces to set a static ip. If you want to change your internet ip (ie. You don't use a router) then you will need to contact your provider

you can change what ip you have on your own lan very freely as long as it falls into the subnet of your router (you can even change that if you want to change all of the address) but the ip you get from your provider is given to you and is out of your control
